notes: Tutorial story: demonstrates HP loss, consumables, equipment, special-item flags, and endings.
No infinite loops: revisits advance state via flags + new exits.
Uses VerseCraft app.js v1205 requirements model: choice.requires supports flag, notFlag, hasItem.

sections.text:
Moonlight breaks on shattered stone. The ruin’s entrance yawns like a cracked jaw, its archway half-swallowed by ivy and time.

You came because the local road has gone quiet—and because something in the dark has started paying attention.

Your candle burns steady, as if it wants to be seen.
sections.system: Tutorial: Your choices move the story. Consequences can change HP, inventory, and flags.

choices.label: Step into the ruin
Circle the entrance and scout for danger

sections.text:
You cross the threshold.

Dust puffs under your boots. A corridor stretches forward—collapsed in places, but passable. Your candlelight catches carvings worn smooth by centuries.

Somewhere deeper, water drips… then stops, as if something listened.

choices.label: Take the corridor straight ahead
Try the side door with a faded chapel sigil

sections.text:
You circle the archway. The stone here is newer—repairs made long after the ruin fell.

You find scuffed footprints in the dirt. Fresh. Not yours.

You also find a thin wire near the threshold—trap-work.
sections.system: Looking around can prevent damage later.

choices.label: Disarm the wire and enter carefully
Enter immediately (no time to waste)

sections.text:
The corridor narrows.

A stone plate shifts under your weight—too late.

A dart hisses from the wall and bites your shoulder.

Pain blooms hot, then cold.
sections.system: HP -3. Tip: Use consumables from Inventory. Healing cannot exceed Max HP.

choices.label: Rip the dart free and keep moving
If you scouted, you spot it in time and avoid the dart
Stop and apply a Bandage

sections.text:
The side door groans as you pull it open.

Inside is a narrow chapel—collapsed roof, shattered altar, and a single iron reliquary still intact.

Your candle flame leans toward it, as if the light recognizes the metal.
sections.system: Special interactions: some scenes respond to what you carry.

choices.label: Examine the reliquary up close
Leave the chapel and return to the corridor

sections.text:
The corridor opens into a fractured hall—pillars broken, mosaics smashed, and a dark pool at the center like spilled ink.

Your candlelight doesn’t reach the far corners.

Then you hear it: a slow scrape of something heavy dragged across stone.

choices.label: Hide behind a broken pillar
Approach the sound with your weapon hand ready
Back away and take the chapel route

sections.text:
You press cloth and pressure to the wound. Your breath steadies.

The pain dulls to a warning. Not gone—just managed.

You move again, a little wiser about where you place your feet.
sections.system: Bandage used. Healing cannot exceed Max HP.

choices.label: Continue to the hall

sections.text:
The reliquary’s latch clicks with a soft surrender.

Inside rests a small charm etched with looping runes: a Warden Sigil.

It’s not powerful. It’s a promise—something that says: you were here, and the ruin knows it.
sections.system: You gained a Special Item (Warden Sigil). Equip it from Inventory → Special.

choices.label: Take the Warden Sigil
Leave it and step away

sections.text:
You tuck yourself behind a pillar, still as stone.

A shape slides into view: a cave-wight—thin limbs, wet-looking skin, eyes like pale coins.

It sniffs the air. Your pulse thunders.

It hasn’t found you yet.

choices.label: Hold your breath and wait for it to pass
Strike while it’s searching

sections.text:
You take two careful steps.

The wight turns as if it heard the idea of you.

It skitters fast—too fast—and clips you with a claw as you recoil.
sections.system: HP -2.

choices.label: Fall back toward the corridor
Hold your ground and fight

sections.text:
The sigil warms in your palm. Not heat—recognition.

A whisper slides through the ruin like a page turning:

You are seen.

You return to the hall with a steadier spine.
sections.system: Tip: Equip the Warden Sigil from Inventory → Special to roleplay the loadout.

choices.label: Return to the hall
Take a breath and check your Inventory

sections.text:
The wight crawls away toward the dark pool.

You exhale slowly.

A clever survivor doesn’t win fights. They avoid them.

But avoidance still has a cost: the ruin is measuring you.

choices.label: Slip along the wall toward a side corridor
Follow the wight at a distance

sections.text:
You commit.

Steel meets wet flesh.

Your weapon lands, and the wight shrieks—thin and furious.

But it rakes your forearm as it recoils. Pain lances bright.
sections.system: HP -4. This is survivable, but dangerous.

choices.label: Press the attack
Fall back and use the environment

sections.text:
You retreat to the corridor mouth.

The hall stays quiet for a heartbeat…

Then something breathes—wet and patient—just beyond the candle’s reach.

You can feel the ruin paying attention now.
sections.system: Tip: You can heal now or later. Inventory → Consumables.

choices.label: Push back into the hall anyway
Take the side corridor you noticed earlier
Duck into the chapel to regroup

sections.text:
You steady your breathing and take stock.

This is the rhythm of VerseCraft: narrative first, systems underneath.

If you’re hurt, you can use a Bandage, Herb Poultice, or Glimmer Tonic—if you have them.

If you find equipment, you can equip it.

If a scene reacts to an item, the story will make it matter.

choices.label: Return to the hall

sections.text:
A side corridor slopes downward.

The air is damp here, and your candle sputters in the draft.

You find a loose slab with scuff-marks—someone has opened it before.

choices.label: Lift the slab and search the cache
Ignore it and continue down the corridor

sections.text:
You shadow the wight toward the pool.

The water isn’t water.

It’s a mirror of a ceiling that isn’t there.

The creature trembles like it’s praying to something below.

choices.label: Throw a pebble into the pool
Back away quietly and take the side corridor

sections.text:
You land a final cut.

The wight collapses in a twitching heap.

Silence follows—heavy, judgmental.

In its nest you find a small vial stoppered in wax, and a folded cloth packet of herbs.
sections.system: Loot gained: Glimmer Tonic + Herb Poultice (consumables).

choices.label: Take the loot and move

sections.text:
You step back into the fractured hall.

The wight is still there.

But it moves differently now—as if it recognizes your shape.

This is not a loop.

This is the same room, after the ruin has learned you exist.
sections.system: Revisits advance. The same scene can evolve.

choices.label: Try to slip past toward the far stair
Run for the side corridor
Risk another fight

sections.text:
You duck into the chapel.

The air is calmer here, like the ruin has rules it won’t break in sacred spaces.

The reliquary sits where you left it.

The candle flame leans, waiting.

choices.label: Search the chapel side alcoves
Return to the hall with renewed focus

sections.text:
Under the slab is a small emergency stash.

A bandage roll. A little iron buckler. A chalk stub for marking walls.

Simple tools, but in ruins, simple tools keep you alive.
sections.system: Loot: Bandage (consumable), Battered Buckler (armor), Chalk (item).

choices.label: Take everything

sections.text:
The corridor deepens.

Water drips. Stone sweats.

You reach a three-way split:

• A stair down into colder air.
• A crawlspace choked with roots.
• A narrow arch with rune-scratches.

choices.label: Take the stair down
Crawl through the roots
Approach the rune-scratched arch

sections.text:
The pebble hits the surface.

The pool doesn’t ripple.

It opens.

A hand—too long, too pale—reaches up and grips the edge.

This is your warning: some choices carry consequences you cannot outfight.
sections.system: WARNING: This is a lethal-risk branch. You can still escape.

choices.label: Run. Now.
Lean closer and look into the pool

sections.text:
Past the hall, a stairwell spirals down.

Your candle throws long shadows that don’t always match your movement.

At the bottom: a sealed door of black stone, carved with looping runes.

There is no handle.

Only a shallow indentation—like it expects a token.
sections.system: Whisper: Some doors answer to what you carry. Check Special Items.

choices.label: Return to the side corridor and search for something that fits
Press the Warden Sigil to the indentation
Force the door with brute strength

sections.text:
In the chapel alcove you find a tiny tin icon and a paper-wrapped strip of resin.

The resin smells like pine sap.

It would make a candle burn brighter.

Or longer.
sections.system: Loot: Candle Resin (item).

choices.label: Take the resin
Leave it and return to the hall

sections.text:
You descend.

The air turns knife-cold.

You feel the ruin beneath the ruin.

Halfway down, the stone gives a tired groan and a chunk breaks loose—clipping your shoulder as it falls.
sections.system: HP -2.

choices.label: Keep going (don’t stop in the cold)
Stop and patch up before you continue

sections.text:
You crawl into the roots.

Thorns tug at your sleeves.

Something sharp scratches your cheek.

You squeeze through and drop into a hidden storage niche.
sections.system: HP -1.

choices.label: Search the niche
Leave immediately (it feels unsafe)

sections.text:
The rune-scratched arch hums faintly.

Your candle flame tightens, like it’s being pulled.

The archway opens into a short hallway of black glassy stone.

At the end: a pedestal with a shallow bowl of ash.

choices.label: Place your candle near the ash bowl
Mark your way with chalk and retreat

sections.text:
You lean closer.

The pool is not a pool.

It’s a mouth.

Cold wraps your face. Fingers hook behind your jaw.

For one heartbeat, you understand: curiosity is not wisdom. Sometimes it’s just hunger wearing a better mask.
sections.system: HP -9. This can end the run if you’re already low.

choices.label: Wrench free and stumble back
Give in to the pull

sections.text:
The Warden Sigil fits the indentation like it was made for your hand.

The black stone door sighs open.

Inside is not treasure.

It’s a passage lined with names—hundreds of them—carved into the walls.

The ruin accepts you.

For now.
sections.system: Progression unlocked: you can go deeper without forcing.

choices.label: Enter the name-lined passage
Step back and explore more first

sections.text:
You slam into the door.

Once.

Again.

Your vision flashes white.

When it finally shifts, it’s not because you won.

It’s because something on the other side let you.

A breath—ancient and pleased—slides across your face.
sections.system: Tip: Forcing doors can cost HP and may worsen outcomes.

choices.label: Step through anyway
Stagger back and retreat

sections.text:
At the bottom of the stair is a cold antechamber.

Your candle flame shortens.

A crack in the wall leaks a whisper of wind.

You spot a rusted iron coffer half-buried in rubble.

choices.label: Open the coffer
Ignore it and follow the whispering wind

sections.text:
You stop in the stairwell and force yourself to be practical.

Pain makes people stupid.

You decide not to be stupid.
sections.system: Tip: Heal now if you can. Inventory → Consumables.

choices.label: Continue down to the antechamber

sections.text:
The niche contains a wrapped bundle: an old iron key and a thin blade in a cracked sheath.

The blade is cleaner than it should be.

As if it doesn’t rust.

As if it remembers violence.
sections.system: Loot: Iron Key (item), Warden Knife (weapon).

choices.label: Take the key and the knife

sections.text:
Your candle flame stretches—thin and vertical—like a blade of light.

The ash in the bowl stirs.

A soft chime sounds from nowhere.

For a moment, you see the ruin’s memory: builders laying stone, wardens swearing oaths, a door sealed in fear and hope.

Then it fades.

You step away with knowledge instead of loot.
sections.system: You triggered a Candle vision. Flag set: CandleMoment.

choices.label: Continue onward (you feel the ruin watching)
Return to the split and explore other paths

sections.text:
You tear away from the pool, gasping.

Your candle sputters—then steadies.

The pool’s surface becomes still again.

But you’ve been marked by whatever lives beneath.

You don’t know what that means yet.

You only know it noticed you back.
sections.system: Tip: If you’re low, consider healing now.

choices.label: Retreat to the side corridor and recover
Push deeper anyway

sections.text:
The name-lined passage feels warmer.

Not safe.

But permitted.

You find a low plinth with carved slots: one shaped like a key, one shaped like a candle stub, one shaped like a sigil.

This place expects offerings.

choices.label: Use the Iron Key on the key-slot
Hold your candle near the candle-slot
Press the Warden Sigil to the sigil-slot
Back out and return to the antechamber

sections.text:
The forced door opens on a narrow passage.

The stone is slick, like it’s been breathed on.

Your candlelight shows faint handprints on the walls.

Too many.

Too small.

Too old.

choices.label: Continue into the passage
Retreat while you still can

sections.text:
The coffer creaks open.

Inside: a small vial labeled in faded script: ANTIDOTE.

Next to it is a thin leather strap—an old tourniquet.

Someone came prepared to bleed.
sections.system: Loot: Antidote (consumable), Tourniquet (item).

choices.label: Take both

sections.text:
You follow the whispering wind.

It leads to a crack in the wall—just wide enough to squeeze through.

Beyond is a hidden maintenance corridor.

The floor here is dustless.

Someone still walks this way.

choices.label: Enter the maintenance corridor
Mark the crack with chalk and return

sections.text:
The maintenance corridor ends at a small iron gate.

The bars are decorated with the same looping runes.

On the floor is a smear of something dark.

Not fully dry.

Not fully fresh.

choices.label: Unlock the gate (if you have a key)
Try to squeeze between the bars
Return to the name-lined passage

sections.text:
The Iron Key turns.

A hidden panel slides aside.

Inside is a small metal token shaped like a drop of wax.

It’s warm, as if it was just held.

As if the ruin is anticipating you.
sections.system: Loot: Wax Token (special).

choices.label: Take the Wax Token

sections.text:
Your candle flame leans into the carved slot.

The plinth hums.

For a moment, the stone feels almost soft.

A whisper slides through the hall:

Not yet.

But soon.
sections.system: Candle hint: some endings depend on CandleMoment.

choices.label: Step away and consider other offerings

sections.text:
The sigil-slot accepts the Warden Sigil.

A line of light runs through the stone like a crack filling with dawn.

A door you didn’t notice before becomes visible.

The ruin isn’t helping.

It’s acknowledging.

choices.label: Enter the newly revealed door
Stay and explore the passage more

sections.text:
The forced passage narrows.

The handprints stop.

Your candle suddenly brightens, as if warning you.

Ahead is a chamber full of hanging chains.

The chains move slightly.

But there is no wind.

choices.label: Step into the chain chamber
Back out and return to safer routes

sections.text:
The gate clicks open.

Beyond is a narrow walkway over black water.

You see something pale beneath the surface—far below.

Not moving.

Waiting.

choices.label: Cross the walkway carefully
Retreat (this feels like a trap)

sections.text:
You squeeze between the bars.

Metal bites into your ribs.

You make it through, but you’re bleeding.

You can keep going—but you should treat it.
sections.system: HP -2. Tip: Use a Bandage or Tourniquet if you have one.

choices.label: Continue anyway
Stop and use a Tourniquet

sections.text:
The revealed door leads to a quiet vault.

On a pedestal rests a clean leather jerkin reinforced with stitched plates.

Better than what you’re wearing.

Beside it: a note carved into stone:

Only the prepared proceed.
sections.system: Loot: Reinforced Jerkin (armor upgrade).

choices.label: Take the armor

sections.text:
The chain chamber hums with tension.

A chain snaps like a whip.

It catches your arm, tearing skin.

The chains don’t want you here.

Or something does—and the chains are warning you away.
sections.system: HP -3.

choices.label: Push through the pain
Retreat before it gets worse

sections.text:
You cross the walkway.

Halfway over, the water below shifts.

A pale shape rolls as if waking.

Your candle flame bends toward it like a compass needle.

You reach the far side and find a black stone door with three shallow impressions:

• A sigil.
• A wax-drop.
• A candle flame.

choices.label: Press the Warden Sigil into the first impression
Place the Wax Token into the wax-drop impression
Hold your candle up to the candle impression
Backtrack to prepare more

sections.text:
Past the chains is a short stair and a low arch.

You emerge into a circular room.

At the center stands a pedestal with a single inscription:

NOT ALL WHO ENTER ARE REMEMBERED.

But some are.

The room feels like a judge.

choices.label: Approach the pedestal
Return to the walkway door

sections.text:
The sigil clicks into place.

A line of light crawls across the door.

It isn’t open yet.

But it’s listening now.

choices.label: Try another impression on the door

sections.text:
The wax token melts slightly—just enough to seal itself into the stone.

The door exhales.

It’s still shut.

But it feels less like a wall, and more like a question.

choices.label: Try another impression on the door

sections.text:
You raise the candle.

If you found Candle Resin, the flame brightens—steady and sharp.

If you triggered CandleMoment earlier, you feel the ruin’s memory stir.

The candle impression glows faintly.

Something is close to opening.

choices.label: If you’ve seen the candle vision, push your candlelight into the stone
Step back and consider other requirements

sections.text:
As you approach the pedestal, the air thickens.

A whisper slides from the stone:

Name yourself.

Not aloud.

In your bones.

You realize: this room doesn’t want your courage.

It wants your commitment.

choices.label: Commit to finishing what you started
Back away (survival is also a choice)

sections.text:
Your candlelight sinks into the stone like breath into glass.

For a moment, the door turns translucent.

You see wardens standing where you stand.

You see a seal being placed.

You see a promise being kept.

The door does not open.

But the ruin recognizes you as not-a-stranger.
sections.system: This is the lore path. Knowledge counts as an ending in Lorecraft.

choices.label: Accept what you’ve learned and leave
Return and try to open the door fully

sections.text:
The ruin answers commitment with pressure.

Your ears ring.

Your candle gutters.

The water below the walkway stirs—waking more fully.

You have time for one decisive move.
sections.system: Tip: Heal if you’re low before you commit to the final push.

choices.label: Go to the final door and complete the sequence
Try to leave now while you can

sections.text:
You stand before the final door.

It wants three things.

Not to trick you.

To verify you.

If you have the sigil and the wax token and the candle vision, you can open what was sealed.

If not, you might still force it.

But forcing has a price.

choices.label: Complete the ritual sequence (Sigil + Wax + Candle Vision)
Force the door with brute strength
Back away and leave alive

sections.text:
The door opens.

Not like a door.

Like a breath being released after centuries.

Inside is a chamber lined with names.

Hundreds.

You add yours with a trembling fingertip.

The ruin accepts you.

For now.

You leave alive, carrying proof that the world responds to those who dare to touch it.
sections.system: GOOD ENDING: You finished the run the intended way.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
You drive your shoulder into the stone.

It doesn’t budge.

Again.

Your vision flashes white.

When the door finally shifts, it’s not because you won.

It’s because something on the other side let you.

A handprint appears on the inside surface of the stone.

Too long.

Too pale.

And then it grabs you.
sections.system: HP -6. If this drops you to 0, the run ends.

choices.label: Fight and stagger away
Your strength fails

sections.text:
You leave the ruin with your heart hammering and your hands shaking.

The night air feels too loud. Too exposed.

You didn’t answer every question.

But you lived.

Sometimes that’s the only victory you can afford.

And sometimes… survival is just postponing the question.
sections.system: GOOD ENDING: You survived and earned progress.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
You retreat—but the ruin follows in ways you can’t see.

Not footsteps.

Not breath.

Attention.

You realize too late:

Some places don’t chase you.

They just remember you.

And memory is a kind of chain.
sections.system: BAD ENDING: You escaped, but you were marked.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
You leave with no treasure.

But you carry a secret:

The ruin is not dead.

It’s deliberate.

It watches.

It responds.

In Lorecraft, knowledge is an outcome.

And sometimes it’s the only safe one.
sections.system: SPECIAL ENDING: You earned a lore revelation. The world noticed you noticing it.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu

sections.text:
Your strength gives out.

The ruin doesn’t rage. It doesn’t gloat.

It simply waits, the way stone waits.

This is the tutorial’s rule: when your resource hits zero, the run ends.

Try again. Learn the danger. Use your items when it matters.

The world that notices is not cruel.

It’s just real.
sections.system: DEATH: First failure is expected. You’re learning VerseCraft’s rules through play.

choices.label: Return To Main Menu
